parameters.text:
=You are an expert Upwork Job Scoring Agent trained to evaluate jobs specifically for Morgan (an automation builder specializing in n8n, AI automations, workflow systems, voice agents, and Twilio/Retell).

Your task is to analyze the job below and score how good it is for Morgan RIGHT NOW based on his current goals:
- get quick wins
- land fast jobs
- build portfolio
- collect testimonials
- increase Upwork profile history
- avoid time-wasting clients

- focus on automation, AI, workflow, systems, voice agents, CRM, Twilio/Retell, n8n-related work

### Output Format JSON (required):

{
  "score": "X/10",
  "reason": "One short paragraph explaining why",
  "priority": "High | Medium | Low"

IMPORTANT ‚Äî PRIORITY RULES (MANDATORY, NO EXCEPTIONS):

- If score is 8, 9, or 10 ‚Üí priority MUST be "High"
- If score is 5, 6, or 7 ‚Üí priority MUST be "Medium"
- If score is 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 ‚Üí priority MUST be "Low"

You are NOT allowed to choose priority independently.
Priority MUST strictly follow the numeric score.
}

### Scoring rules:
HIGH PRIORITY (8‚Äì10/10) if:

- Job is clearly automation-related (n8n, automation, workflow, AI, chatbot, voice agent, Twilio, Retell, Zapier, Make, API integrations)
- Client looks easy to work with
- Budget is reasonable
- Job can be completed quickly (under 48 hours)
- Client has history OR high payment verification



MEDIUM PRIORITY (5‚Äì7/10) if:
- Some automation work but unclear scope
- Job might be longer than ideal
- Client is new with no history
- Budget is low but still worth doing for profile building

LOW PRIORITY (1‚Äì4/10) if:
- Not automation related
- Job looks like a headache
- Client unclear / bad reviews / very low rate
- WordPress / graphic design / irrelevant work
- Long-term dev projects unsuitable for quick wins



### Job Data:
Title:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.title }}
Description:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.description }}
URL:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.url }}
Posted:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.Posted }}

Job Type:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.jobType }}
Experience Level:{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.experienceLevel }}

IMPORTANT:
A preliminary skill score has already been calculated using deterministic rules.
Pre-calculated Skill Score: {{ $json.custom_skill_score }}

IMPORTANT:

A preliminary skill relevance score has been calculated using deterministic rules:
Pre-calculated Skill Score: {{ $json.custom_skill_score }}

This score is ONLY a rough signal of keyword relevance.

You MUST prioritize CONTEXTUAL INTENT over keywords.

You are allowed to significantly increase or decrease the final score
based on:
- whether skills are REQUIRED vs optional
- clarity of scope
- urgency
- whether this looks like a quick, focused task
- whether the client expects deep experience or casual familiarity

If skills are mentioned as "nice to have", "preferred", or "a plus",
you SHOULD LOWER the score.

If skills are mentioned as "required", "mandatory", or clearly essential,
you SHOULD INCREASE the score.

Final score must reflect REAL PRIORITY for quick wins,
not keyword count.

Before responding, verify:
- Score and priority are consistent.
- A score of 8+ NEVER has Medium or Low priority.
If inconsistent, FIX IT before output.

LOW PRIORITY OVERRIDES:

If the job description includes ANY of the following signals,
you MUST reduce the score and may classify it as LOW priority
even if automation or AI keywords are present:

- The work is long-term, ongoing, full-time, or part-time
- The scope is vague, exploratory, or "to be discussed"
- The client is looking for an agency or large team
- The job does not describe a clear, quick, well-defined task

json.title: AI Automation Engineer: Financial Systems Integration (APIs etc.) ~ $300/month +Bonuses
json.description:
Hello Upwork Family,
This is a focused automation role supporting a financial advisory systems integration project.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who can execute clearly defined workflows, follow architecture guidance, and implement reliable automations across multiple tools.

This is not a senior architect role; strategy is already defined. We need a strong implementer.

Systems involved:
Wealthbox (CRM)
PreciseFP (intake)
RightCapital (planning)
SuiteDash (client portal)

What you‚Äôll work on:
Workflow implementation
API or webhook-based data flows
Automation testing and validation
Light documentation

Time & Pay:
$300/month
+Generous Bonuses
Phase-based scope
Clear priorities and timelines
Opportunity to continue with us on post-launch

To apply for this role kinndly answer that following questions:
1. Have you worked with APIs or webhooks beyond Zapier? And can you create custom APIs?
2. How do you ensure data stays consistent across systems?
3. Are you comfortable working from an existing technical plan?

I look forward to working with you. ‚ú®

json.title: n8n Automation Expert Needed
json.description: Seeking an expert to automate workflows and integrate APIs using n8n. The role involves creating and managing automated workflows, integrating various APIs, and ensuring seamless data flow between systems. Ideal candidates will have extensive experience with n8n and a strong understanding of API integration.

json.title: Airtable Client Decision Dashboard Builder
json.description:
Overview
We are an MSP and we want to build a client-facing decision dashboard that turns messy IT asset data into simple executive decisions.

Example decision we want clients to see:
Client has 10 computers
Our standard is to replace computers before the 4-year mark
3 computers are 5 years old
Dashboard should show: Replace 3 computers now with a clear recommendation and cost estimate
We currently use ConnectWise and may migrate to NinjaRMM in the future, so the solution should be built in a way that can adapt to different data sources.

Project Goals
Build a clean system that allows us to:
Track client assets (computers and servers)
Apply lifecycle rules (example replace computers over 4 years old)
Display a simple decision dashboard per client
Allow Approve or Defer type decisions (optional but preferred)
Keep it easy enough for a CEO and client to understand

Scope and Deliverables
Phase 1 MVP Pilot for 1 Client
Build an Airtable base that includes:
A) Tables
Clients
Assets (computers, servers)
Standards or Policies (example replace computers at 4 years)
Decisions or Recommendations (example Replace Now, Replace Soon, Healthy)
B) Fields and Logic
Asset purchase date OR install date OR age
Calculated age in years
Lifecycle status:
Healthy
Replace Soon (within 6 months)
Replace Now (past 4 years)
Decision summary rollups per client (counts and totals)
C) Client Dashboard
Build a clean Airtable Interface (preferred) or view that shows:
Total computers
Number Replace Now
Number Replace Soon
This Month‚Äôs Decisions list
Recommended action plus reason
Estimated replacement cost (can be a range or per-device estimate)
D) Output
We want a working pilot for one real client first.
Phase 2 Optional or Nice-to-Have
If MVP goes well, we may extend scope to include:
Automation or syncing from ConnectWise or RMM tool
Approve or Defer workflow
Push approved decisions into ClickUp or ConnectWise projects
Add other decision types (backup compliance, warranty expiration, server lifecycle)
Data Source
For MVP, we can provide data by:
CSV export from ConnectWise
Manual sample data
Or another simple import method
The goal is to prove the dashboard works before building complex integrations.
Required Skills
Airtable base design (tables, linked records)
Airtable formulas, rollups, filtering
Airtable Interfaces experience
Ability to design a client-friendly UI (executive-level simplicity)
Application Requirements Important

To be considered, you must include:
A Loom video walkthrough showing Airtable dashboards or Interfaces you have built
1 to 2 examples of Airtable work (screenshots or links are fine)
A short explanation of how you would structure the Airtable tables for clients to assets to decisions
Confirmation whether you have worked with MSPs, ConnectWise, or RMM data before (yes or no)
Your estimated timeline and cost for MVP
Preferred Skills Bonus
MSP experience (ConnectWise, Ninja, RMM knowledge)
Zapier or Make.com automation
API integration experience
Client portal or dashboard experience
Success Criteria
This project is successful if:
A client can open a dashboard and immediately understand:
what decisions they need to make
why it matters
what it will cost
The system is easy for our internal team to maintain and expand
Timeline
MVP Pilot: 7 to 14 days from kickoff

json.title: N8N Automation Specialist for Business Data
json.description: Seeking an N8N automation specialist to develop automations for extracting business data and social media content. The role involves creating processes to find specific businesses, gather their information, and organize it in spreadsheets for sales teams. Additionally, the specialist will analyze trending social media content in a niche and craft high-performing ads and scripts.

json.title: Hiring Expert n8n Engineers for Production-Ready Automation Workflows
json.description:
We are an AI automation agency, and as our client base grows, our workflows are becoming more complex. We‚Äôre looking to hire experienced n8n Engineers who work in n8n daily and have built production-ready, scalable workflows.

This is not a beginner role. We need specialists who deeply understand n8n and real-world automation challenges.

Requirements

Strong hands-on experience with n8n in production

Ability to build, maintain, and debug complex workflows

Solid understanding of APIs, webhooks, authentication, error handling, and data transformations

Experience optimizing workflows for reliability and scale

Make.com experience is a plus

How to apply (required)

To be considered, your proposal must follow these steps:

Start your proposal with:
‚Äúlet‚Äôs grow‚Äù

Submit a Loom video where you:

Introduce yourself

Walk through the most complex automation project you‚Äôve built (preferably in n8n)

Explain the challenges and how you solved them

Include:

Your hourly rate

Your availability to interview within the next two weeks

Your weekly availability

We‚Äôre looking for long-term partners as our agency scales. If n8n is what you live in daily, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

json.title: N8n progaming
json.description: I need help fine tuning my n8n/Gmail automation to include my signature line and for Chat GPT to access certain files and my calendar with replying to emails. Can you help with this?

json.title: Fix n8n Web Scraper Automation Not Sending Google Leads to Google Sheets
json.description:
I‚Äôm a restaurant owner using an n8n workflow to scrape restaurant leads from Google and automatically save them into a Google Sheet. The workflow runs successfully, but the data is not being written to the Google Sheet as expected.

I‚Äôm looking for someone experienced with n8n automations and Google Sheets integrations to review the existing workflow, identify the issue with the node configuration or data mapping, and fix it so the leads are properly saved.

This is a small troubleshooting and fix task. No new features or major changes are needed, just making the current setup work correctly.

Experience with n8n, web scraping workflows, and Google Sheets is required.

json.title: E-Commerce Automation and Data Systems Specialist (Amazon SP-API, Sheets, Shopify)
json.description:
We are a global premium coffee brand selling across Amazon, Shopify, and other platforms. We are hiring a developer-minded E-Commerce Automation and Data Systems Specialist to own our automation, reporting, and data infrastructure end to end.

This is a hands-on technical role focused on Amazon SP-API, Google Sheets, Google Apps Script, and automation tools (Make/n8n/Zapier). You will centralize Amazon data (orders, FBA, inventory, ads, fees, refunds/returns), build reliable daily refreshes, and create KPI dashboards and alerts used by leadership, marketing, finance, and operations.

You will also support off-Amazon customer and marketing automations, and help automate accounting and operations workflows (OCR invoices, PO/COGS tracking, supplier and payment reporting).

Must-have: real SP-API experience (LWA auth, refresh tokens, throttling, error handling, JSON parsing). Developer-level thinking required, but this is not a pure software engineering position.

Please include your CV with your Upwork application.

json.title: Experienced n8n + Ollama Developer Needed for Workflow Automation
json.description:
We are seeking an experienced n8n and Ollama developer to create a robust workflow that processes interview questions and responses using Llama 3.3 70B. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of automation tools and experience with Llama's capabilities. You will be responsible for ensuring seamless integration and efficient processing of inputs and outputs. If you have expertise in workflow automation and a passion for leveraging AI, we want to hear from you!

The Challenge:
Our current AI scoring system (Cassidy.ai) fails 33% of the time, returning fake default scores instead of real analysis. We need to migrate to a self-hosted solution with full control and observability.

The Solution:
Build an n8n workflow that processes 10-15 interview questions through Ollama (Llama 3.3 70B on,  a Hetzner (or similar) GPU), scoring multiple organizational health indicators per question response, then aggregating results. This replaces processing 134 indicators individually.

Key Requirements:
Set up and secure Ollama on Hetzner GPU server (Llama 3.3 70B)
Build n8n workflow using question-first approach (20+ LLM calls, not 134)
Implement aggregation logic for indicators mentioned multiple times
Validate evidence exists for every scored indicator (no fake scores)
Ensure 85%+ consistency across repeated runs of same transcript
Store results in MySQL (Hostinger)

Deliverables:
Working n8n workflow with full documentation
Ollama server configured with remote access and security
GitHub repo with all prompts, schemas, and code
Test results proving consistency (5 transcripts √ó 3 runs each)
1-hour handover session

Timeline: 2 weeks maximum
Week 1: Setup + build + test on sample data
Week 2: Process real transcripts + tune + deploy

Must Have:
Proven n8n workflow experience (portfolio required)
LLM API integration (OpenAI/Anthropic/Ollama)
JavaScript proficiency for aggregation logic
Linux server administration basics
Available to start within 7 days

Nice to Have:
Previous Ollama deployments
Experience with organizational/HR analytics
Prompt engineering expertise
MySQL optimization knowledge

json.title: AI Developer for Automotive Services
json.description: Seeking an experienced AI developer to create conversational and voice agents for automotive services. These agents will manage incoming calls and messages, qualify prospects, answer client questions, and schedule appointments, integrating with CRM, calendars, and messaging tools. Ideal candidates will have operational skills, not beginners. Experience with OpenAI/GPT-4, voice AI (Twilio), chatbot development, automation tools (Zapier, Make, n8n), and API/webhook integrations is essential. Long-term collaboration possible for the right profile.
